maml:description.maml:para: Installs a package.
Installs a package and its dependencies into the project.
Specifies the package ID of the package to install. Now it can also point to an online or local path to packages.config file or package's nupkg file.
Installs only this package and not its dependencies.
Specifies the project to install the package into. If ommitted, the default project is chosen.

Specifies the URL or directory path for the package source containing the package to install. When set to a local file system path, Source can be either absolute or relative to the current directory. If omitted, looks in the currently selected package source to find the corresponding package URL.
Specifies the version of the package to install. If omitted, defaults to the latest version.
Indicates whether this command will consider prerelease packages. If omitted, only stable packages are considered.
Indicates what this command should do if a file from the package's content folder already exists in the project.
Specifies which dependency package version to install. If omitted, this defaults to the lowest required version.
Displays the actions that would be taken and the effect of the command, instead of executing the command.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Description ------------------------------------------------------------------ Installs the latest version of the Elmah package from the current package source into the default project.
Description ------------------------------------------------------------------ Installs version 1.0.0 of Glimpse into the project named MvcApplication1

Description ------------------------------------------------------------------ Installs the package, Ninject.Mvc3, but not its dependencies. It looks in the directory, c:\temp\packages to find the package.
Description ------------------------------------------------------------------ Installs the package listed on the online packages.config, Newtonsoft.Json version 4.0.1 into the current project.
Description ------------------------------------------------------------------ Installs jquery 1.10.2 package, using the .nupkg file under local path of c:\temp\packages.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the set of remote packages with specified Id/keyword from the package source.
Gets the set of remote packages with specified Id/keyword from the package source.
Specifies the package ID of the package to find.

Specifies the URL or directory path for the package source containing the package to install. When set to a local file system path, Source can be either absolute or relative to the current directory. If omitted, looks in the currently selected package source to find the corresponding package URL.
Gets all versions of packages available from the online package source.
Specifies the number of packages to return from the beginning of the list.
Skips (does not return) the specified number of packages, counting from the beginning of the list.
Indicates whether to include prerelease packages in the returned results.
Indicates whether to return packages with the exact packageID (case-insensitive).
Indicates whether to return packages with packageId starting with the specified string.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Description ------------------------------------------------------------------ Returns packages with keyword Elmah from the package source.
Description ------------------------------------------------------------------ Returns jquery package with all versions available from the package source.
Description ------------------------------------------------------------------ Returns package with Ids starting with the word of 'Elmah'.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the set of installed packages. Use the -Updates flag to list packages updates available from the package source.
Gets the set of installed packages. Use the -Updates flag to list packages updates available from the package source.

Specifies the URL or directory path for the package source containing the package to install. When set to a local file system path, Source can be either absolute or relative to the current directory. If omitted, looks in the currently selected package source to find the corresponding package URL.
Gets packages available from the online package source.
Specifies the project to get installed packages from. If ommitted, the command will return installed projects for the entire solution.
Gets packages that have an update available from the package source.
Specifies a filter string used to narrow down the list of packages returned. The filter is searched for in the package Id, the description and tags.
Specifies the number of packages to return from the beginning of the list.
Skips (does not return) the specified number of packages, counting from the beginning of the list.
Displays all available versions of a package. The latest version of each package is listed by default.
Indicates whether to include prerelease packages in the returned results.
Used with -ListAvailable. When specified, paging will be enabled to display the list of packages.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Description ------------------------------------------------------------------ Returns packages installed in the current solution.
Description ------------------------------------------------------------------ Returns packages installed in the "MyProject" project.
Description ------------------------------------------------------------------ Returns a list of packages available online in the current package source in the page size of 30.
Description ------------------------------------------------------------------ Returns a list of packages available online using "Ninject" as a search term.
Description ------------------------------------------------------------------ Returns a list of packages installed in the default project that have updates available in the current package source.

maml:description.maml:para: Uninstalls a package.
Uninstalls a package. If other packages depend on this package, the command will fail unless the –Force option is specified.
Specifies the package ID of the package to uninstall.
Uninstalls the package and its unused dependencies.
Specifies the project to uninstall the package from. If ommitted, the default project is chosen.
Forces an uninstall of the package even if another package depends on it.
The version of the package to uninstall. If omitted, defaults to the latest version.
Displays the actions that would be taken and the effect of the command, instead of executing the command.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Description ------------------------------------------------------------------ Uninstalls the Elmah package from the default project.

Description ------------------------------------------------------------------ Uninstalls the Elmah package as well as all its dependencies. If any dependency has another package that depends on it, it is skipped.
Description ------------------------------------------------------------------ Uninstalls the Elmah package even if another package depends on it.

maml:description.maml:para: Updates a package.
Updates a package and its dependencies to a newer version.
Specifies the package ID of the package to update. If omitted, every package is updated.
Updates all of the package’s dependencies to the latest version. False by default.
Specifies the project containing the project to update. If ommitted, the package is updated in every project with the package installed.

Constrains upgrades to newer versions with the same Major and Minor version component. For example, if version 1.0.0 of a package is installed, and versions 1.0.1, 1.0.2, and 1.1 are available in the feed, the -Safe flag updates the package to 1.0.2.

Specifies the URL or directory path for the package source containing the package to update. When set to a local file system path, Source can be either absolute or relative to the current directory. If omitted, looks in the currently selected package source to find the corresponding package URL.
Specifies the version that the package will be upgraded to. If omitted, defaults to the latest version.
Indicates whether to include prereleases when searching for updates. If omitted, only stable packages are considered.
Reinstall packages with the existing versions.
Indicates what this command should do if a file from the package's content folder already exists in the project.
Specifies which dependency package version to install. If omitted, this defaults to the lowest required version.
Specifies to move to the highest minor version on update. If omitted, this defaults to the highest compatible version.
Specifies to move to the highest patch version on update. This is the same as Safe. If omitted, this defaults to the highest compatible version.
Displays the actions that would be taken and the effect of the command, instead of executing the command.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Description ------------------------------------------------------------------ Updates the Elmah package installed in every project to the latest version.
Description ------------------------------------------------------------------ Updates the Elmah package to a specific version in every project.

Description ------------------------------------------------------------------ Updates every package in the project, MvcApplication1, to the latest "safe" version. For example, if version 1.0.0 of a package is installed, and versions 1.0.1, 1.0.2, and 1.1 are available in the feed, the -Safe flag updates the package to 1.0.2.

Description ------------------------------------------------------------------ Updates every package in the project, MvcApplication1, to the highest minor version but keeps the major version. For example, if version 1.0.0 of a package is installed, and versions 1.1.0, 1.2.0, and 2.0.0 are available in the feed, the -ToHighestMinor flag updates the package to 1.2.0.

maml:description.maml:para: Get the version of installed package from specified/default project and sync the version to the rest of projects in the solution.
Get the version of installed package from specified/default project and sync the version to the rest of projects in the solution.
Specifies the package ID of the package to install.
Installs only this package and not its dependencies.
Specifies the project to install the package into. If ommitted, the default project is chosen.

Specifies the URL or directory path for the package source containing the package to install. When set to a local file system path, Source can be either absolute or relative to the current directory. If omitted, looks in the currently selected package source to find the corresponding package URL.
Specifies the version of the package to install. If omitted, defaults to the latest version.
Indicates whether this command will consider prerelease packages. If omitted, only stable packages are considered.
Indicates what this command should do if a file from the package's content folder already exists in the project.
Specifies which dependency package version to install. If omitted, this defaults to the lowest required version.
Displays the actions that would be taken and the effect of the command, instead of executing the command.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Description ------------------------------------------------------------------ Sync the version of Elmah package from the default project to the rest of projects in the solution.
Description ------------------------------------------------------------------ Sync the version of Elmah package from the ClassLibrary1 project to the rest of projects in the solution.

maml:description.maml:para: Adds binding redirects to the config file.

Examines all assemblies within the output path for a project and adds binding redirects to the application (or web) configuration file where necessary. NOTE: As of NuGet 1.2, NuGet automatically runs this command when installing a package.
Specifies the project to analyze and add binding redirects to.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Description ------------------------------------------------------------------ Adds binding redirects to the specified project, MyProjectName.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the specified project. If none is specified, returns the default project.
Returns a reference to the DTE (Development Tools Environment) for the specified project. If none is specifed, returns the default project selected in the Package Manager Console.
Specifies the project to return. If ommitted, the default project selected in the Package Manager Console is returned.
Returns every project in the solution.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Description ------------------------------------------------------------------ Returns a reference to the default project.
Description ------------------------------------------------------------------ Returns a reference to the specifed project, MyProjectName.
Description ------------------------------------------------------------------ Returns a reference to every project in the solution. The order of the projects returned is not deterministic.
